pr_title: Issue #17 - Split JAX-RS methods from business logic and refactor exception handling

timeline.message:
Split JAX-RS methods from business logic

1. split FHIRResource in half.  Now `FHIRResource` is just the JAXRS
part.  The "doX" methods that serve as a bridge to FHIRPersistence
methods has been moved to FHIRRestHelper.

2. removed http-specific info (uri, http headers, request properties,
and security context) from FHIRPersistenceEvent...the idea is to add
these back in as FHIRRequestContext properties as needed

3. removed PROPNAME_RESOURCE_HELPER from FHIROperationContext...its
already passed directly to the operations as an argument to `doInvoke`

4. removed httpheaders from FHIRNotificationEvent

5. minor whitespace cleanup in DocumentOperation and
HealthcheckOperation (and tests)

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

issue #17 - move exception handling and logging into FHIRResource

Previously, we logged all errors in the `doX` methods which are now in
FHIRRestHelper. However, this can result in an issue if there is an
exception that occurs after the `doX` method but before we return the
response.

Similarly, before the prior commit, we were writing audit log messages
from the `doX` methods as well.

With this change
1. all exception handling is moved to FHIRResource
2. exception logging is consolidated under
`FHIRResource.exceptionResponse`
3. audit logging is added to a finally block for each JAX-RS operation

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

timeline.message:
issue #17 - move exception handling and logging into FHIRResource

Previously, we logged all errors in the `doX` methods which are now in
FHIRRestHelper. However, this can result in an issue if there is an
exception that occurs after the `doX` method but before we return the
response.

Similarly, before the prior commit, we were writing audit log messages
from the `doX` methods as well.

With this change
1. all exception handling is moved to FHIRResource
2. exception logging is consolidated under
`FHIRResource.exceptionResponse`
3. audit logging is added to a finally block for each JAX-RS operation

I also
* tweaked FHIRResourceHelpers.doBundle to take a bundle and moved that
validation up to FHIRResource
* updated SearchExceptionUtil to include OperationOutcome.Issue so that
we don't need to special-case search exceptions
Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

timeline.message:
Add httpHeaders to FHIRRequestContext

Set HttpHeaders map on FHIRRequestContext...making them available to
persistence interceptors once again.

Moved JAX-RS header parameters into the method signatures (using
`@HeaderParam`).

Also upgraded `javax.ws.rs-api` to version 2.1 to match what we use from
liberty.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
